etymologies: Old English bēte, of West Germanic origin, from Latin beta, perhaps of Celtic origin; related to Dutch beet and German Bete

definitions: a herbaceous plant widely cultivated as a source of food for humans and livestock, and for processing into sugar. Some varieties are grown for their leaves and some for their large nutritious root.

notes.text: Beta vulgaris, family Chenopodiaceae: several subspecies

shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant cultivated for processing into sugar

definitions: the edible dark red spherical root of a kind of beet, eaten as a vegetable.
shortDefinitions: edible dark red root of kind of beet

definitions: the variety of beet that produces dark red edible roots.
shortDefinitions: variety of beet that produces this root
